RE:
LETTER OF OFFER TO SELL PLOT NUMBER {{doc.unit_no}} MEASURING AN EIGHTH ACRE EXCISED FROM BLOCK NUMBERS A38, A39, A40, A 41 AND A42, ALL FORMING PART OF LAND REFERENCE NUMBER 11295”).

We are in the process of completing the purchase of block numbers A38, A39, A40, A41 and A42 (``the property’’) from National Cooperative Housing Union Limited (NACHU) of P.O Box 51693-00200 Nairobi (``the transaction’’) and sub-dividing the property into various Plots.

In this regard we are pleased to offer to you the subject plot in the property, subject to contract by way of a formal Agreement for Sale to be prepared by the our Advocates upon payment of the full deposit amount and based on the following terms and conditions:

Deposit of Kenya Shillings ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND SHILLINGS ONLY (Kshs. 100,000.00) to be paid upon signing this letter of offer
Balance to be paid in {{doc.repayment_period}} Equal Monthly Instalments.


b) All payments towards the Purchase Price shall be paid into the Vendor`s Bank Account details as given below:

Bank : CFC STANBIC BANK KENYA
Account Name: KIFARU MEADOWS LIMITED
Account Number: 01000010135227
Branch: CFC STANBIC BANK KENYA LTD CHIROMO ROAD
Swift Code: SBICKENX


8.
State of the Plot
The Vendor has afforded you the opportunity to inspect the plot and are satisfied as to its state and condition.

9.
Completion Date
It is envisioned that the sale and purchase of the Plot shall be completed within Seven (7) days of the execution of the Agreement for Sale.

10.
Failure to Complete
In the event that the Purchaser shall not be able to complete this transaction after the signing of the Agreement for Sale, then it is agreed by and between the parties hereto that the Vendor will be entitled to withhold as liquidated damages ten percent (10%) of the Purchase Price and well as legal fees of our Advocates and any other costs incidental to the preparation of this Letter of Offer, Agreement for Sale and any other documents incidental to this transaction in which case the said Agreement will be deemed to have terminated and neither party shall then have a claim against the other

11.
Legal fees , Disbursement costs and Expenses
All documents relating to this transaction shall be prepared by our Advocates and the Purchaser shall cater for the legal fees, disbursement costs and government charges which shall be payable upon signing the Agreement for Sale as follows:
Government Advocate
PARTICULARS AMOUNT (Kshs) AMOUNT (Kshs)
1. Stamp duty on the Sale Agreement 500
Stamp duty on the Transfer to be calculated @4% of the Value of the Plot Approximately 114,000 (subject to valuation and assessment by the Government Valuer)
2. Bank Charges on payment of Stamp Duty 500
3. Consent to Transfer by the Land Control Board or Commissioner of Lands (if applicable) 15,000
4. Registration fees for the Transfer 5,000
5. Professional legal fees for preparation of the Agreement for Sale and Transfer and procuring stamping and registration of the Transfer (and charge if any) as per the Advocates Remuneration Order (2014) 50,000
6. Disbursements 10,000
7. VAT @ 16% on legal fees and disbursements above 9,600
Total

Approximately
135,000

Approximately
69,600.00


12.
Acceptance
Kindly confirm your acceptance of this offer by signing three copies of this Letter of Offer and return the same to us within Seven (7) days from the date of this Letter together with the following documents:
If the purchaser is an individual:

(a) A copy of your Kenya National ID or passport (b) A copy of your KRA PIN

If the purchaser is a company:

(a) A copy of the certificate of incorporation of the company

(b) A copy of the latest CR 12 of the Company

(c) A copy of the KRA PIN of the Company

(d) Copies of the Kenya National ID and KRA PIN of the directors


13.
Lapse of Offer
This offer is subject to your acceptance of the same and upon expiry of this Letter of Offer, without full compliance, the written offer will automatically lapse and the Plot offered to any other prospective buyer.

14.
Agreement for Sale
We shall upon receipt of the duly signed Letter of Offer forward to our Advocates to prepare the Agreement for Sale and who shall in turn forward it to you for signature within Fourteen (14) days of receipt thereof and return to them for execution by the registered owner and ourselves. A copy of Agreement for Sale when duly executed and stamped will be forwarded by our Advocates directly to you for your record. The Agreement for sale shall supersede this Letter of Offer.

15.
Execution of the Transfer Instrument & Consent to Transfer
The registered owner shall execute the Transfer Instrument and the consent to transfer the subject Plot to you on behalf of the Vendor who is the beneficial owner of the Plot

16.
Administration Cost
In the event that you do not sign the Agreement for Sale, you will forfeit to the Vendor, Kshs. 50,000/- being administrative costs.

17.
Please sign and return three copies of this letter of offer to enable our Advocates prepare the Agreement for Sale.

Yours faithfully,
On Behalf of Kifaru Meadows Limited



KIFARU PROPERTIES LTD
RITAH WAIRIMU
